===Mahmood family=== Mohammad Tariq Mahmood, his brother and their children were stopped from boarding a [[Norwegian Air Shuttle|Norwegian Air]] flight from [[Gatwick Airport|Gatwick]] to Los Angeles on 15 December 2015. At the airport, the family from Walthamstow found their entry visas to the United States had been cancelled.<ref name="Dearden241215">{{cite news|last=Dearden|first=Lizzie|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/katie-hopkins-congratulates-homeland-security-staff-who-stopped-british-muslim-familys-holiday-to-a6785076.html|title=Katie Hopkins congratulates Homeland Security staff who stopped British Muslim family's Disneyland holiday|work=The Independent|date=24 December 2015|accessdate=19 December 2016}}</ref>
In December 2016, the [[Daily Mail and General Trust]] settled a libel case brought by the Mahmood family with £150,000 damages, plus legal costs, over two articles by Hopkins posted on the Mailonline website which claimed members of the Muslim family were extremists.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38367563|title=Katie Hopkins apologises to family over al-Qaeda claims|publisher=BBC News|date=19 December 2016|accessdate=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref name="ITV191216">{{cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2016-12-19/mailonline-forced-to-pay-out-150k-over-libellous-katie-hopkins-column/|title=MailOnline forced to pay out £150k over libellous Katie Hopkins column|publisher=ITV News|date=19 December 2016|accessdate=19 December 2016}}</ref> The columns published at the time of the incident falsely claimed that officials were right to stop the family flying to Los Angeles to visit [[Disneyland]] because the two men were connected to [[Al-Qaeda|al-Qaida]], and that their stated plans were a "lie".<ref name="Jackson">{{cite news|last=Jackson|first=Jasper|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/dec/19/mail-pays-out-150k-to-muslim-family-over-katie-hopkins-column|title=Mail pays out £150k to Muslim family over Katie Hopkins column|work=The Guardian|date=19 December 2016|accessdate=19 December 2016}}</ref> In the settlement, the assertions from the Mahmood family were accepted as true by the ''Mail'' and Hopkins; the family had arranged to stay with another brother living in California,<ref name="ITV191216"/> The family's MP, [[Stella Creasy]], complained to the prime minister [[David Cameron]] at the time about the family's treatment, but Hopkins said Creasy was a "whinging…blond-bobbed maniac".<ref name="Dearden241215"/>
In a statement from the family's solicitors, [[Carter-Ruck]], they said: "matters are not helped when sensationalist and, frankly, Islamophobic articles such as this are published, and which caused us all a great deal of distress and anxiety. We are very pleased that the record has been set straight".<ref name="Jackson"/><ref>{{cite news|last=Blair|first=Olivia|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/katie-hopkins-twitter-apology-muslim-family-extremism-links-mail-online-column-a7484436.html|title=Katie Hopkins tweets apology to Muslim family she linked to extremists – at 2 am|work=The Independent|date=19 December 2016|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> The two articles by Hopkins about the Mahmood family have been removed from the Mailonline website.<ref>{{cite news|last=Bowden|first=George|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/katie-hopkins-apologises_uk_5857b020e4b0e9baa877e873|title=Katie Hopkins Issues Extraordinary Apology To Muslim Family After Mail Online Columns|work=HuffPost|date=19 December 2016|accessdate=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/dec/19/mail-pays-out-150k-to-muslim-family-over-katie-hopkins-column|title=Mail pays out £150,000 to Muslim family over Katie Hopkins column|first=Jasper|last=Jackson|date=19 December 2016|work=The Guardian|accessdate=26 May 2017}}</ref>
===Jackie Teale===
In November 2017, Hopkins' former employers [[Mail Online]] apologised and paid "substantial damages" to teacher Jackie Teale, after Hopkins had made false accusations of taking her class to a [[Donald Trump]] protest in Westminster.<ref name="Ruddick281117"/>
===Daily Mirror===
In May 2018, Hopkins won an [[Independent Press Standards Organisation|IPSO]] case against the ''[[Daily Mirror]]'' for claiming that she had been detained in South Africa in February 2018 for taking [[ketamine]].<ref>{{cite new|last=Embury-Dennis|first=Tom|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/katie-hopkins-daily-mirror-south-africa-headline-drug-racism-ipso-complaint-a8367581.html|title=Katie Hopkins wins IPSO case against Daily Mirror for claiming she was detained for drugs rather than 'spreading racial hatred'|work=The Independent|date=25 May 2018|access-date=25 May 2018}}</ref> The ''Mirror'' updated the headline to say that she had been detained for spreading racial hatred, and included a correction in the article.<ref>{{cite news|last=Saunders|first=Emmeline|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/katie-hopkins-detained-south-africa-11977548|title=Katie Hopkins DETAINED in South Africa for 'spreading racial hatred' after taking ketamine while collapsed in the street|work=The Mirror|date=6 February 2018|access-date=25 May 2018}}</ref>
==Political life== In the [[European Parliament election, 2009 (United Kingdom)|2009 European Parliament Election]], Hopkins stood as a candidate for the [[South West England (European Parliament constituency)|South West England Constituency]] as an [[Independent politician|Independent]] candidate. She polled 8,971 votes or 0.6% of the total votes cast.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/shared/bsp/hi/elections/euro/09/html/ukregion_36.stm |title=European Election 2009 | South West |publisher=BBC News |date=8 June 2009 |accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Apprentice villain Katie Hopkins standing for Euro election|url=http://www.westerndailypress.co.uk/Apprentice-villain-Katie-Hopkins-standing-Euro-election/story-12300046-detail/story.html|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=Western Daily Press|date=11 May 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141111180920/http://www.westerndailypress.co.uk/Apprentice-villain-Katie-Hopkins-standing-Euro-election/story-12300046-detail/story.html|archivedate=11 November 2014}}</ref>
In late September 2015, Hopkins spoke at a fringe event organised by the [[Electoral Reform Society]] at the [[UK Independence Party]] (UKIP)'s annual conference. After derogatory comments about the appointment of [[Michelle Mone]] to the [[House of Lords]], she said: "Frankly, I don't really mind if we seal up the room and gas the lot of them".<ref>{{cite news|last=Jackson|first=Jasper|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2015/sep/25/katie-hopkins-wouldnt-mind-if-house-of-lords-was-sealed-up-and-gassed|title=Katie Hopkins 'wouldn't mind' if House of Lords was sealed up and gassed|work=The Guardian|date=25 September 2015|accessdate=25 September 2015}}</ref>
UKIP said Hopkins was not a party member and, although she has reportedly applied to join on several occasions, her applications have always been rejected.<ref>{{cite news|last=Payne|first=Sebastian|url=http://blogs.spectator.co.uk/coffeehouse/2015/09/watch-ukip-supporter-katie-hopkins-advocates-gassing-the-house-of-lords/|title=Watch: Ukip supporter Katie Hopkins advocates gassing the House of Lords|work=The Spectator (Coffee House blog)|date=25 September 2015|accessdate=25 September 2015}}</ref>
In November 2015, students at [[Brunel University]] turned their backs on her, then walked out in protest at her presence in a debate.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/mediamonkeyblog/2015/nov/26/katie-hopkins-brunel-university-students-turn-backs-video|title=The moment students turned their backs on Katie Hopkins' hate speech|date=26 November 2015|work=The Guardian|accessdate=26 November 2015}}</ref>
==Personal life== Hopkins' first husband was Damian McKinney, a former [[Royal Marine]] and founder and Chief Executive of the company McKinney Rogers; they married in September 2004 in Exeter.<ref name="birth"/><ref name="Aitkenhead"/> He was married to another woman when they first met; she has admitted to having [[adultery|"stolen" him]].<ref name="Thring"/> McKinney left Hopkins for another woman soon after the birth of the couple's second daughter.<ref name="Sanghera">{{cite news|last=Sanghera|first=Sathnam|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/magazine/article4471465.ece|title=Katie Hopkins – bigmouth strikes again|work=The Times magazine|date=20 June 2015|accessdate=19 December 2016}} {{subscription required}}</ref> While working at the Met Office, she met Mark Cross, a married design manager. In 2010, her marriage to Cross was filmed as part of the reality game show ''[[Four Weddings]]'', which is shown on the satellite and cable channel [[Sky Living]].<ref name="test">[http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23802644-reality-tv-wedding-for-apprentice-maneater-katie-hopkins.do Reality TV wedding for Apprentice 'maneater' Katie Hopkins] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100605155338/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23802644-reality-tv-wedding-for-apprentice-maneater-katie-hopkins.do |date=5 June 2010 }}. ''London Evening Standard'', 5 February 2010. Retrieved 15 August 2013</ref>
Hopkins formerly suffered from [[epilepsy]]; she was being hospitalised around once every 10 days in early 2014, she told Decca Aitkenhead: "When I have a fit at night, my arms come out. They dislocate. So I have to go into hospital to have them relocated. That's happened 26 times in the last nine months".<ref name="Aitkenhead"/><ref name="Blair201115">{{cite news|last=Blair|first=Olivia|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/katie-hopkins-hospitalised-after-smashing-her-face-in-epilepsy-fit-a6742471.html|title=Katie Hopkins hospitalised after 'smashing her face' in epilepsy fit|work=The Independent|date=20 November 2015|accessdate=20 November 2015}}</ref> The seizures could occur up to ten times at night, according to Sathnam Sanghera who interviewed her for ''The Times'' in mid-2015.<ref name="Sanghera"/> They began in her late teens whenever she fell asleep and did not respond to prescribed drugs, she said in 2017.<ref name="Thring">{{cite news|last=Thring|first=Oliver|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news-review/katie-hopkins-i-want-to-save-britain-but-im-no-bob-geldof-mwbsmn78w|title=Katie Hopkins: I want to save Britain, but I’m no Bob Geldof|work=The Sunday Times|date=5 November 2017|accessdate=5 November 2017}} {{subscription required}}</ref> In a piece for ''The Sun'', published the following August, she announced she was undergoing surgery to help prevent seizures.<ref name="Dearden010815">{{cite news|last=Dearden|first=Lizzie|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/katie-hopkins-reveals-fear-she-will-die-during-brain-surgery-to-cure-epilepsy-10432500.html|title=Katie Hopkins reveals fear she will die during brain surgery to cure epilepsy|work=The Independent|date=1 August 2015|accessdate=2 August 2015}}</ref> In mid-November 2015, her condition led her to fall to the ground in the street, injuring her face, and for an ambulance to be called.<ref name="Blair201115"/><ref>{{cite news|last=Powell|first=Emma|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/katie-hopkins-confirms-epilepsy-left-her-with-a-smashed-face-as-she-thanks-strangers-for-help-a3119366.html|title=Katie Hopkins confirms epilepsy left her with a 'smashed face' as she thanks strangers for help|work=London Evening Standard|date=20 November 2015|accessdate=20 November 2015}}</ref> She faced a Twitter backlash after, due to her previously asking her followers to tweet pictures of immigrants using health services.<ref>https://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/katie-hopkins-forced-to-defend-herself-after-receiving-medical-treatment-for-collapse-in-south-a3758256.html</ref>
In February 2016, she underwent surgery in which a portion of her brain was removed to relieve the severity of the condition.<ref name=surgery>{{cite news|title=Katie Hopkins undergoes brain surgery to treat epilepsy|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2016-02-22/katie-hopkins-undergoes-brain-surgery-to-treat-epilepsy/|accessdate=24 February 2016|publisher=ITV|date=22 February 2016}}</ref> Hopkins tweeted a month later that the operation was a success. "I am no longer an epileptic", she tweeted.<ref name="Powell240316">{{cite news|last=Powelll|first=Emma|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/katie-hopkins-reveals-brain-surgery-was-a-success-i-am-no-longer-an-epileptic-a3211101.html|title=Katie Hopkins reveals brain surgery was a success: I am no longer an epileptic|work=London Evening Standard|date=24 March 2016|accessdate=29 March 2016}}</ref> According to Hopkins, the surgery has, however, led to complications.<ref name="Thring"/>
Hopkins sold her Exeter home in March 2018 for £930,000.<ref>{{cite news|last=Penberthy-Hutchins|first=Tina|url=https://www.devonlive.com/news/property/katie-hopkins-luxury-devon-home-1526502|title=Katie Hopkin's luxury Devon home was one of the most expensive sold this year|work=Devon Live|date=2 May 2018|accessdate=2 May 2018}}</ref> She applied for an [[individual voluntary arrangement]] in May 2018 to avoid bankruptcy.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Saunders |first1=Emmeline |title=Katie Hopkins files for IVA amid crippling debts 18 months after losing libel case against Jack Monroe |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/katie-hopkins-secretly-forced-file-13254535 |accessdate=16 September 2018 |work=The Mirror |date=16 September 2018}}</ref><ref name=the=guardian-katie-hopkins-applies-for-insolvency-to-avoid-bankruptcy-after-jack-monroe-twitter-costly-libel-case>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/sep/16/katie-hopkins-applies-for-insolvency-to-avoid-bankruptcy-after-jack-monroe-twitter-costly-libel-case|title=Katie Hopkins applies for insolvency agreement to avoid bankruptcy|last=Waterson|first=Jim|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|date=16 September 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018}}</ref>

{{General relativity sidebar |solutions}}
The '''Kerr–Newman metric''' is a solution of the [[Einstein's field equation#Einstein–Maxwell equations|Einstein–Maxwell equations]] in [[general relativity]] that describes the spacetime geometry in the region surrounding a charged, rotating mass. This solution has not been especially useful for describing astrophysical phenomena, because observed astronomical objects do not possess an appreciable net [[electric charge]].{{Citation needed|date=December 2016}} The solution has instead been of primarily theoretical and mathematical interest. (It is assumed that the [[cosmological constant]] equals zero.)
==History== In 1965, [[Ezra T. Newman|Ezra "Ted" Newman]] found the axisymmetric solution of Einstein's field equation for a black hole which is both rotating and electrically charged.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Newman |first=Ezra |last2=Janis |first2=Allen |title=Note on the Kerr Spinning-Particle Metric |journal=[[Journal of Mathematical Physics]] |volume=6 |issue=6 |pages=915–917 |date=1965 |doi=10.1063/1.1704350 |bibcode = 1965JMP.....6..915N }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |last=Newman |first=Ezra |last2=Couch |first2=E. |last3=Chinnapared |first3=K. |last4=Exton |first4=A. |last5=Prakash |first5=A. |last6=Torrence |first6=R. |title=Metric of a Rotating, Charged Mass |journal=Journal of Mathematical Physics |volume=6 |issue=6 |pages=918–919 |date=1965 |doi=10.1063/1.1704351 |bibcode = 1965JMP.....6..918N }}</ref> This formula for the [[metric tensor]] <math>g_{\mu \nu} \!</math> is called the Kerr–Newman metric. It is a generalisation of the [[Kerr metric]] for an uncharged spinning point-mass, which had been discovered by [[Roy Kerr]] two years earlier.<ref name="kerr_1963">{{cite journal | last = Kerr | first = RP | authorlink = Roy Kerr | date = 1963 | title = Gravitational field of a spinning mass as an example of algebraically special metrics | journal = Physical Review Letters | volume = 11 | pages = 237–238 | doi = 10.1103/PhysRevLett.11.237 | bibcode=1963PhRvL..11..237K | url=http://prola.aps.org/abstract/PRL/v11/i5/p237_1}}</ref>
Four related solutions may be summarized by the following table:
{| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto" | | Non-rotating (''J'' = 0) | Rotating (''J'' ≠ 0) |- | Uncharged (''Q'' = 0) | [[Schwarzschild metric|Schwarzschild]] | [[Kerr metric|Kerr]] |- | Charged (''Q'' ≠ 0) | [[Reissner–Nordström metric|Reissner–Nordström]] | Kerr–Newman |}
where ''Q'' represents the body's [[electric charge]] and ''J'' represents its spin [[angular momentum]].
==Mathematical form== The Kerr–Newman metric describes the geometry of [[spacetime]] for a rotating charged black hole with mass ''M'', charge ''Q'' and angular momentum ''J''. The formula for this metric depends upon what coordinates or [[coordinate conditions]] are selected. One way to express this metric is by writing down its [[line element]] in a particular set of [[Spherical coordinate system|spherical coordinates]],<ref>Hajicek, Petr et al. [https://books.google.com/books?id=1vEe-8ktTJsC&pg=PA243 An Introduction to the Relativistic Theory of Gravitation], page 243 (Springer 2008).</ref> also called [[Boyer–Lindquist coordinates]]:
:<math>c^{2} d\tau^{2} = -\left(\frac{dr^2}{\Delta} + d\theta^2 \right) \rho^2 + \left(c \, dt - a \sin^2 \theta \, d\phi \right)^2 \frac{\Delta}{\rho^2} - \left(\left(r^2 + a^2 \right) d\phi - a c\, dt \right)^2 \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\rho^2}</math>
where the coordinates (''r'', ''θ'', ''ϕ'') are standard [[oblate spheroidal coordinate system]], and the length-scales:
:<math> a = \frac{J}{Mc}\,, </math>
:<math> \ \rho^{2}=r^2+a^2\cos^2\theta\,, </math>
:<math> \ \Delta=r^2-r_sr+a^2+r_Q^2\,, </math>
have been introduced for brevity. Here ''r<sub>s</sub>'' is the [[Schwarzschild radius]] of the massive body, which is related to its total mass-equivalent ''M'' by
:<math> r_{s} = \frac{2GM}{c^{2}} </math>
where ''G'' is the [[gravitational constant]], and ''r''<sub>''Q''</sub> is a length-scale corresponding to the [[electric charge]] ''Q'' of the mass
:<math> r_{Q}^{2} = \frac{Q^{2}G}{4\pi\epsilon_{0} c^{4}} </math>
where 1/(4π''ε''<sub>0</sub>) is [[Coulomb's law|Coulomb's force constant]].
The total mass-equivalent ''M'', which also contains the [[Electric potential energy|electric field-energy]] and the [[rotational energy]], and the irreducible mass ''M''<sub>irr</sub> are related by<ref>[[Thibault Damour]]: [http://lapth.cnrs.fr/pg-nomin/chardon/IRAP_PhD/BlackHolesNice2012.pdf#page=11 Black Holes: Energetics and Thermodynamics], page 11</ref><ref>Parthapratim Pradhan: [https://arxiv.org/pdf/1310.7126.pdf#page=9 Black Hole Interior Mass Formula], page 9, Eq. 57</ref>
:<math>M_{\rm irr} = \frac{\sqrt{2 M^2-r^2_Q c^4/G^2+2 M \sqrt{M^2-(r^2_Q +a^2) c^4/G^2}}}{2} \ \to \ M=\sqrt{\frac{16 M_{\rm irr}^4+8 M_{\rm irr}^2 \ r^2_Q c^4/G^2+r^4_Q c^8/G^4}{16 M_{\rm irr}^2-4a^2 c^4/G^2}}</math>
In order to electrically charge and/or spin a neutral and static body, energy has to be applied to the system. Due to the [[mass–energy equivalence]], this energy also has a mass-equivalent; therefore ''M'' is always higher than ''M''<sub>irr</sub>. If for example the rotational energy of a black hole is extracted via the [[Penrose process]]es<ref name="mtw">[[Charles Misner]], [[Kip Thorne|Kip S. Thorne]], [[John Archibald Wheeler|John. A. Wheeler]]: ''[https://www.pdf-archive.com/2016/03/21/gravitation-misner-thorne-wheeler/ Gravitation]'', pages 877 & 908</ref><ref name="bhat">Bhat, Dhurandhar & Dadhich: [https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF02715080 Energetics of the Kerr–Newman Black Hole by the Penrose Process], page 94 ([http://1oJcZf PDF]: page 11)</ref>, the remaining mass-energy will always stay greater than or equal to ''M''<sub>irr</sub>.
===Component form=== The components of the Kerr–Newman metric can be read off after a simple algebraic re-arrangement:
:<math>\begin{align} c^{2} d\tau^{2} & = \frac{(\Delta - a^2 \sin^2 \theta)}{\rho^2} \; c^2 \; dt^2 - \left(\frac{\rho^2}{\Delta} \right) dr^2 \\
& - \rho^2 d\theta^2 + (a^2 \Delta \sin^2 \theta - r^4 - 2 r^2 a^2 - a^4) \frac{\sin^2 \theta \; d\phi^2}{\rho^2} \\ & - (\Delta - r^2 - a^2) \frac{2 a \sin^2 \theta \; c \; dt \; d\phi}{\rho^2} \end{align}</math>
===Electromagnetic field tensor=== The electromagnetic potential in Boyer–Lindquist coordinates is<ref>Brandon Carter: ''[https://luth.obspm.fr/~luthier/carter/trav/Carter68.pdf#page=3 Global structure of the Kerr family of gravitational fields]'' (1968)</ref><ref name="luongo">Orlando Luongo, Hernando Quevedo: ''[https://arxiv.org/pdf/1407.1530.pdf#page=2 Characterizing repulsive gravity with curvature eigenvalues]''</ref>
:<math>A_{\mu}=\left( \frac{r \ r_Q }{\rho^2},0,0,-\frac{c^2 \ a \ r \ r_Q \sin ^2 \theta }{\rho^2 \ G \ M} \right) </math>
while the Maxwell-tensor is defined by
:<math>F_{\mu\nu} = \frac{\partial A_\nu}{\partial x^{\mu}} - \frac{\partial A_\mu}{\partial x^{\nu}} \ \to \ F^{\mu\nu}=g^{\mu\sigma} \ g^{\nu\kappa} \ F_{\sigma \kappa}</math>
In combination with the [[Christoffel symbols]] the second order [[Kerr–Newman_metric#Equations_of_motion|equations of motion]] can be derived with
:<math>{{\ddot x^i = - \Gamma^i_{j k} \ {\dot x^j} \ {\dot x^k} + q \ {F^{i k}} \ {\dot x^j}} \ {g_{j k}}}</math>
where <math>q</math> is the charge per mass of the testparticle.
===Alternative (Kerr–Schild) formulation=== The Kerr–Newman metric can be expressed in "Kerr–Schild" form, using a particular set of [[Cartesian coordinate system|Cartesian coordinates]] as follows.<ref name="Debney">Debney, G. et al. [http://link.aip.org/link/?JMAPAQ/10/1842/1 "Solutions of the Einstein and Einstein–Maxwell Equations,"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130223203626/http://link.aip.org/link/?JMAPAQ/10/1842/1 |date=2013-02-23 }} ''Journal of Mathematical Physics'', Volume 10, page 1842 (1969). Especially see equations (7.10), (7.11) and (7.14).</ref><ref>Balasin, Herbert and Nachbagauer, Herbert. [https://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/9312028v1 “Distributional Energy-Momentum Tensor of the Kerr–Newman Space-Time Family.”] (Arxiv.org 1993), subsequently published in ''Classical and Quantum Gravity'', volume 11, pages 1453–1461, [http://cat.inist.fr/?aModele=afficheN&cpsidt=4105419 abstract] (1994).</ref><ref>Berman, Marcelo. “Energy of Black Holes and Hawking’s Universe” in ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=DGwYf8cOCq4C&pg=PA148&dq=%22Kerr-Newman%22+and+cartesian&ei=zR5cSY6EC4KEzgTUwZCQDg#PPA149,M1 Trends in Black Hole Research]'', page 148 (Kreitler ed., Nova Publishers 2006).</ref> These solutions were proposed by [[Roy Patrick Kerr|Kerr]] and [[Alfred Schild|Schild]] in 1965.
:<math>g_{\mu \nu} = \eta_{\mu \nu} + fk_{\mu}k_{\nu} \!</math>
:<math>f = \frac{Gr^2}{r^4 + a^2z^2}\left[2Mr - Q^2 \right]</math>
:<math>\mathbf{k} = ( k_{x} ,k_{y} ,k_{z} ) = \left( \frac{rx+ay}{r^2 + a^2} , \frac{ry-ax}{r^2 + a^2}, \frac{z}{r} \right) </math>
:<math>k_{0} = 1. \!</math>
Notice that '''k''' is a [[unit vector]]. Here ''M'' is the constant mass of the spinning object, ''Q'' is the constant charge of the spinning object, ''η'' is the [[Minkowski space#Standard basis|Minkowski tensor]], and ''a'' is a constant rotational parameter of the spinning object. It is understood that the vector <math>\vec{a}</math> is directed along the positive z-axis. The quantity ''r'' is not the radius, but rather is implicitly defined like this:
:<math>1 = \frac{x^2+y^2}{r^2 + a^2} + \frac{z^2}{r^2}</math>
Notice that the quantity ''r'' becomes the usual radius ''R''
:<math>r \to R = \sqrt{x^2 + y^2 + z^2}</math>
when the rotational parameter ''a'' approaches zero. In this form of solution, units are selected so that the speed of light is unity (''c'' = 1). In order to provide a complete solution of the [[Einstein's field equation#Einstein–Maxwell equations|Einstein–Maxwell Equations]], the Kerr–Newman solution not only includes a formula for the metric tensor, but also a formula for the electromagnetic potential:<ref name="Debney" /><ref>Burinskii, A. [https://books.google.com/books?id=sCrtjHPcY3gC&pg=PA321&dq=%22kerr-newman%22+and+%22potential%22+and+electromagnetic&lr=&as_brr=3&ei=27ReSdjSAqSsyASVxIz6Bg#PPA321,M1 “Kerr Geometry Beyond the Quantum Theory”] in ''Beyond the Quantum'', page 321 (Theo Nieuwenhuizen ed., World Scientific 2007). The formula for the vector potential of Burinskii differs from that of Debney et al. merely by a gradient which does not affect the fields.</ref>
:<math>A_{\mu} = \frac{Qr^3}{r^4 + a^2z^2}k_{\mu}</math>
At large distances from the source (R >> a), these equations reduce to the [[Reissner–Nordström metric]] with:
:<math>A_{\mu} = \frac{Q}{R}k_{\mu}</math>
In the Kerr–Schild form of the Kerr–Newman metric, the determinant of the metric tensor is everywhere equal to negative one, even near the source.<ref name="Exact">Stephani, Hans et al. ''Exact Solutions of Einstein's Field Equations'' (Cambridge University Press 2003). See [https://books.google.com/books?id=SiWXP8FjTFEC&pg=PA485&dq=%22Kerr-Schild%22+and+%22determinant+of+the+metric%22&num=100 page 485] regarding determinant of metric tensor. See [https://books.google.com/books?id=SiWXP8FjTFEC&pg=PA325&lpg=PA325&dq=%22Kerr+newman+is+a+special+case%22&source=bl&ots=7U1Qz6nQ6M&sig=T4HkKMr0UmwjBwT7SLTQiSMt760&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=13&ct=result#PPA325,M1 page 325] regarding generalizations.</ref>
== Important surfaces == [[File:Kerr-Flaechen_thumbnail.gif|220px|thumb|right|link=File:Kerr-surfaces.png|Event horizons and ergospheres of a charged and spinning black hole in pseudospherical r,θ,φ and cartesian x,y,z coordinates.]] [[File:Black.Hole,Extremal.Kerr.Newman,Raytracing.png|220px|thumb|[[Ray_tracing_(physics)|Ray traced]] shadow of a spinning and charged black hole with the parameters a²+Q²=1M². The left side of the black hole is rotating towards the observer.]] Setting <math>g_{rr}</math> to 0 and solving for <math>r</math> gives the inner and outer [[event horizon]], which is located at the Boyer-Lindquist coordinate :<math>r_{\text{H}}^{\pm} = \frac{r_{\rm s}}{2} \pm \sqrt{\frac{r_{\rm s}^2}{4} - a^2 - r_Q^2}.</math> Repeating this step with <math>g_{tt}</math> gives the inner and outer [[ergosphere]] :<math>r_{\text{E}}^{\pm} = \frac{r_{\rm s}}{2} \pm \sqrt{\frac{r_{\rm s}^2}{4} - a^2 \cos^2\theta - r_Q^2}.</math>
== Equations of motion == [[File:Kerr-Newman-Orbit-1-thumbnail.gif|thumb|right|220px|link=File:Kerr-Newman-Orbit-1.gif|Testparticle in orbit around a spinning and charged black hole (a/M=0.9, Q/M=0.4)]] For brevity, we further use dimensionless natural units of <math>G=M=c=K=1</math>, with [[Coulomb's constant]] <math>K</math>, where <math>a</math> reduces to <math>Jc/G/M^2</math> and <math>Q</math> to <math>Q/M \ \sqrt{K/G}</math>, and the equations of motion for a testparticle of charge <math>q</math> become<ref name="cebeci">Hakan Cebeci et al: [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/288890529_Motion_of_the_charged_test_particles_in_Kerr-Newman-Taub-NUT_spacetime_and_analytical_solutions ''Motion of the charged test particles in Kerr–Newman–Taub–NUT spacetime and analytical solutions'']</ref><ref name="hackman">Eva Hackmann, Hongxiao Xu: [https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.2142.pdf#page=4 ''Charged particle motion in Kerr–Newmann space-times''], p. 4</ref>
:<math>\dot t</math><math> = \frac{\csc ^2 \theta \ ({L_z} (a \ \Delta \sin ^2 \theta -a \ (a^2+r^2) \sin ^2 \theta )-q \ Q \ r \ (a^2+r^2) \sin ^2 \theta +E ((a^2+r^2)^2 \sin ^2 \theta -a^2 \Delta \sin ^4 \theta ))}{\Delta \Sigma }</math>
:<math>\dot r = \pm \frac{\sqrt{((r^2+a^2) \ E - a \ L_z \ q \ Q \ r)^2-\Delta \ (C+r^2)}}{\rho^2}</math>
:<math>\dot \theta = \pm \frac{\sqrt{C-(a \cos \theta)^2-(a \ \sin^2 \theta \ E-L_z)/\sin \theta}}{\rho^2}</math>
:<math>\dot \phi = \frac{E \ (a \ \sin^2 \theta \ (r^2+a^2)-a \ \sin^2 \theta \ \Delta)+L_z \ (\Delta-a^2 \ \sin^2 \theta)-q \ Q \ r \ a \ \sin^2 \theta}{\rho^2 \ \Delta \ \sin^2\theta}</math>
with <math>E</math> for the total energy and <math>L_z</math> for the axial angular momentum. <math>C</math> is the [[Carter constant]]:
:<math>C = p_{\theta}^{2} + \cos^{2}\theta \left( a^{2}(1 - E^{2}) + \frac{L_z^2}{ \sin^2\theta}\right) = a^2 \ (1-E^2) \ \sin^2 \delta + L_z^2 \ \tan^2 \delta = {\rm const.}</math>
where <math>p_{\theta} = \dot \theta \ \rho^2</math> is the poloidial component of the testparticle's angular momentum, and <math>\delta</math> the orbital inclination angle.
:<math>L_z = \frac{v^{\phi} \ \bar R}{\sqrt{1-v^2}} = {\rm const.}</math>
and
:<math>E = \sqrt{\frac{\Delta \ \rho^2}{(1-v^2) \ \chi}} + \Omega \ L_z = {\rm const.}</math>
are also conserved quantities.
:<math>\Omega = -\frac{g_{t\phi}}{g_{\phi\phi}} = \frac{a \left(2 r-Q^2\right)}{\chi }</math>
is the frame dragging induced angular velocity. The shorthand term <math>\chi</math> is defined by
:<math>\chi = \left(a ^2+r^2\right)^2-a ^2 \ \sin ^2 \theta \ \Delta</math>
The relation between the coordinate derivatives <math>\dot r, \ \dot \theta, \ \dot \phi</math> and the local 3-velocity <math>v</math> is
:<math>v^{r} = \dot r \ \sqrt{\frac{\rho^2 \ (1-v^2)}{\Delta}}</math>
for the radial,
:<math>v^{\theta} = \dot \theta \ \sqrt{\rho^2 \ (1-v^2) }</math>
for the poloidial,
:<math>v^{\phi} = \frac{L_z \sqrt{1-v^2}}{\bar R}</math>
for the axial and
:<math>v = \frac{\sqrt{\dot t^2-\varsigma^2}}{\dot t} = \sqrt{\frac{\chi \ (E-L_z \ \Omega )^2 -\Delta \ \rho^2}{\chi \ (E-L_z \ \Omega )^2}}</math>
for the total local velocity, where
:<math>\bar R = \sqrt{-g_{\phi \phi}} = \sqrt{\frac{\chi}{\rho^2}} \ \sin \theta</math>
is the axial radius of gyration (local circumference divided by 2π), and
:<math>\varsigma = \sqrt{g^{t t}} = \frac{\chi }{\Delta \ \rho^2}</math>
the gravitational time dilation component. The local radial escape velocity for a neutral particle is therefore
:<math>v_{\rm esc}=\frac{\sqrt{\varsigma^2-1}}{\varsigma} </math>.
== Special cases and generalizations == The Kerr–Newman metric is a generalization of other [[exact solutions in general relativity]]:
* [[Kerr metric]] if the charge ''Q'' is zero. * [[Reissner–Nordström metric]] if the angular momentum ''J'' (or ''a'') is zero. * [[Schwarzschild metric]] if the charge ''Q'' and the angular momentum ''J'' (or ''a'') are zero. * [[Minkowski space]] if the mass ''M'', the charge ''Q'', and the rotation parameter ''a'' are all zero. Also, if gravity is intended to be removed, Minkowski space arises if the gravitational constant G is zero (with electric and magnetic fields more complicated than simply the [[Magnetic moment#Magnetic field produced by a magnetic moment|fields of a charged magnetic dipole]]). The Kerr–Newman solution (with cosmological constant equal to zero) is also a special case of more general exact solutions of the Einstein–Maxwell Equations.<ref name="Exact" />
==Some aspects of the solution== Newman's result represents the simplest [[stationary spacetime|stationary]], [[axial symmetry|axisymmetric]], asymptotically flat solution of [[Einstein's equations]] in the presence of an [[electromagnetic field]] in four dimensions. It is sometimes referred to as an "electrovacuum" solution of Einstein's equations.
Any Kerr–Newman source has its rotation axis aligned with its magnetic axis.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Punsly|first=Brian|title=High‐Energy Gamma‐Ray Emission from Galactic Kerr–Newman Black Holes. I. The Central Engine|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|date=10 May 1998|volume=498|issue=2|doi=10.1086/305561|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/0004-637X/498/2/640/|accessdate=16 May 2013 |page=646 |quote=All Kerr–Newman black holes have their rotation axis and magnetic axis aligned; they cannot pulse.|bibcode = 1998ApJ...498..640P }}</ref> Thus, a Kerr–Newman source is different from commonly observed astronomical bodies, for which there is a substantial angle between the rotation axis and the [[magnetic moment]].<ref>Lang, Kenneth. ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=RdCUsMy3l7EC&pg=PA96&dq=%22magnetic+dipole+moment%22+and+%22axis%22+and+%22the+sun%22&as_brr=3&ei=4DFdScHGIo6syATH6NmRAQ The Cambridge Guide to the Solar System]'', page 96 (Cambridge University Press, 2003).</ref>
If the Kerr–Newman potential is considered as a model for a classical electron, it predicts an electron having not just a magnetic dipole moment, but also other multipole moments, such as an electric quadrupole moment.<ref name="Kjell">Rosquist, Kjell. [https://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/0412064v3 "Gravitationally Induced Electromagnetism at the Compton Scale,"] Arxiv.org (2006).</ref> An electron quadrupole moment has not been detected empirically yet.<ref name="Kjell" />
In the G=0 limit, the electromagnetic fields are those of a charged rotating disk inside a ring where the fields are infinite. The total field energy for this disk is infinite, and so this G=0 limit does not solve the problem of infinite [[self-energy]].<ref>Lynden-Bell, D. [https://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/0410109v1 "Electromagnetic Magic: The Relativistically Rotating Disk,"] ''Physical Review D'', Volume 70, 105017 (2004).</ref>
Like the [[Kerr metric]] for an uncharged rotating mass, the Kerr–Newman interior solution exists mathematically but is probably not representative of the actual metric of a physically realistic [[rotating black hole]] due to stability issues. Although it represents a generalization of the Kerr metric, it is not considered as very important for astrophysical purposes since one does not expect that realistic [[black hole]]s have an important [[electric charge]].
The Kerr–Newman metric defines a black hole with an event horizon only when the following relation is satisfied:<ref>[[Reinhard Meinel]]. [https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007%2F978-3-319-20046-0_6 "A Physical Derivation of the Kerr–Newman Black Hole Solution"].</ref>
:<math>a^2 + Q^2 \leq M^2.</math>
An electron's ''a'' and ''Q'' (suitably specified in [[geometrized units]]) both exceed its mass ''M'', in which case the metric has no event horizon and thus there can be no such thing as a [[black hole electron]] — only a [[naked singularity|naked]] spinning ring singularity.<ref>Burinskii, Alexander. [https://arxiv.org/abs/hep-th/0507109 "The Dirac-Kerr electron,"] Arxiv.org (2005).</ref> Such a metric has several seemingly unphysical properties, such as the ring's violation of the [[cosmic censorship hypothesis]], and also appearance of causality-violating [[closed timelike curve]]s in the immediate vicinity of the ring.<ref>[[Brandon Carter|Carter, Brandon]]. [http://prola.aps.org/abstract/PR/v174/i5/p1559_1 Global Structure of the Kerr Family of Gravitational Fields,] ''Physical Review'' 174, page 1559 (1968).</ref>
The Russian theorist Alexander Burinskii wrote in 2007: "In this work we obtain an exact correspondence between the wave function of the Dirac equation and the spinor (twistorial) structure of the Kerr geometry. It allows us to assume that the Kerr–Newman geometry reflects the specific space-time structure of electron, and electron contains really the Kerr–Newman circular string of Compton size". The Burinskii paper describes an electron as a gravitationally confined ring singularity without an event horizon. It has some, but not all of the predicted properties of a black hole.<ref>Burinskii, Alexander. [https://arxiv.org/abs/0712.0577 "Kerr Geometry as Space-Time Structure of the Dirac Electron,"] Arxiv.org (2007).</ref>
==The electromagnetic fields== The electric and magnetic fields can be obtained in the usual way by differentiating the four-potential to obtain the [[Electromagnetic tensor|electromagnetic field strength tensor]]. It will be convenient to switch over to three-dimensional vector notation.
:<math>A_{\mu} = \left(-\phi, A_x, A_y, A_z \right) \,</math>
The static electric and magnetic fields are derived from the vector potential and the scalar potential like this: :<math>\vec{E} = - \vec{\nabla} \phi \,</math> :<math>\vec{B} = \vec{\nabla} \times \vec{A} \,</math> Using the Kerr–Newman formula for the four-potential in the Kerr–Schild form yields the following concise complex formula for the fields:<ref>Gair, Jonathan. [http://www.ast.cam.ac.uk/~jgair/research/kerrnewman.html "Boundstates in a Massless Kerr–Newman Potential"].</ref>
:<math>\vec{E} + i\vec{B} = -\vec{\nabla}\Omega\,</math>
:<math>\Omega = \frac{Q}{\sqrt{(\vec{R}-i\vec{a})^2}} \,</math>
The quantity omega (<math>\Omega</math>) in this last equation is similar to the [[Electric potential#Electric potential due to a point charge|Coulomb potential]], except that the radius vector is shifted by an imaginary amount. This complex potential was discussed as early as the nineteenth century, by the French mathematician [[Paul Émile Appell]].<ref>Appell, Math. Ann. xxx (1887) pp. 155–156. Discussed by Whittaker, Edmund and Watson, George. ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=ULVdGZmi9VcC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Whittaker+Watson+and+Appell+and+1887&source=gbs_book_other_versions_r&cad=1_1#PPA400,M1 A Course of Modern Analysis]'', page 400 (Cambridge University Press 1927).</ref>

{{multiple issues| {{essay-like|date=December 2015}} {{refimprove|date=December 2015}} {{tone|date=December 2015}} }} {{Infobox artist | name = Lea Lublin | image = | caption = | birth_name = Léa Lublin | birth_date = 1929 | birth_place = [[Brest, Belarus|Brest]], [[Poland]] | death_date = 1999 | death_place = [[Paris]], [[France]] | resting_place = | nationality = | education = [[Academia Nacional de Bellas Artes]], [[Buenos Aires]], Argentina | known_for = Painting, performance, video | notable_works = {{unbulleted list | ''[[La mémoire de l'histoire rencontre la mémoire de l'ordinateur]]'' (1985) | ''[[L'ange de Piero della Francesca]]'' (1980) | ''[[Le corps à-mère, l'objet perdu de MD]]'' (1995) | ''[[Six peintres sur ordinateur]]'' (1985) | ''[[La mémoire de l'histoire rencontre la mémoire de l'ordinateur - 1]]'' (1985) | ''[[La mémoire de l'histoire rencontre la mémoire de l'ordinateur - 2]]'' (1985) }} | movement = [[feminist art]] | spouse = }} '''Lea Lublin''' (born 1929, [[Brest, Belarus|Brest]], Poland, died in 1999, [[Paris]], France<ref name="Centre Pompidou">{{cite web|title=Personne: Lea Lublin|url=https://www.centrepompidou.fr/cpv/resource/cAnXgG5/rGbggEp|website=Centre Pompidou|accessdate=19 June 2015}}</ref>) was an Argentine-French performance artist. Her involvement with [[feminist movement]]s and themes included the [[WACK! Art and the Feminist Revolution]] in [[Los Angeles]] in 2007.
==Early life == Lea Lublin [[History of the Jews in Argentina|emigrated]] with her family to Argentina in 1931 and grew up in [[Buenos Aires]].<ref>Lea Lublin: Retrospective 2015, p. 158</ref> There she attended classes at the [[:es:Escuela Nacional de Bellas Artes Prilidiano Pueyrredón|Prilidiano Pueyrredón National School of Fine Arts]] from age 12 on and graduated in 1949.<ref name="re-act feminism">{{cite web|title=Re-act feminism: Léa Lublin - Mon fils|url=http://www.reactfeminism.org/entry.php?l=lb&id=219&e=t|website=Re-act feminism|accessdate=19 June 2015}}</ref> Lublin began her artist life as painter, but in mid-1960 after her move to Paris, she began her interest in exploration of new media and materials. This interest lead her to cooperation with [[Centro de Artes Visuales of the Institute Torquato di Tella]], an Argentinean center for experimental and avant-garde art.
== Career == Lublin's work investigates imagery, often searching for what may not have yet been seen within imagery that is otherwise familiar.<ref>{{Cite book|url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/contemporary-women-artists/oclc/40869639&referer=brief_results|title=Contemporary women artists|last=Hillstrom|first=Laurie Collier|last2=Hillstrom|first2=Kevin|date=1999-01-01|publisher=St. James Press|isbn=1558623728|location=Detroit|page=407-409|language=English}}</ref> Her work has been influenced by psychoanalysis and feminist thought.<ref name=":0">"LUBLIN, Lea." ''Benezit Dictionary of Artists''. ''Oxford Art Online''. Oxford University Press.</ref>
Lublin activated her works, often encouraging the viewer to interact with the work. For example, she mounted glass over painted reproductions of famous, iconographic paintings such as the [[Mona Lisa]] and installed windshield wipers onto the glass. The audience was invited to squirt water on the painting, which would be cleared again by the wipers.<ref>Lea Lublin: Retrospective 2015, p. 96</ref><ref name=":0" />
Large-scale [[Installation art]] works followed. Lublin immersed viewers into the work, using made-to-specs inflatable tubes and objects, as well as black light and dark rooms or heaps of tiny plastic balls in which audience members could sit and cover themselves.
Lublin also created [[performance art]] sometimes called "exhibition-performances."<ref name=":0" /> In "Mon fils" (1968), she participated in the respectable May Exhibition in Paris by taking her baby son to the museums during the regular exhibition hours and exhibiting him and herself by doing the normal care of changing diapers, breast feeding and putting her son to sleep in his bed that she had brought with them.<ref name="Lenbachhaus" /> This brought public attention to social and gender roles in her work. She continued performances of this kind in [[Argentina]] and [[Chile]] until the end of the 1960s. Her next work the "Terranauts" (1969) was deeply influenced by French feminism. Lublin eventually moved permanently to Paris, where she worked and lived until her death in 1999.
In her work, Lublin left behind the flat canvas that she had used as painter and became part of the movement of the 1960s that used art as a means for involved active social dialogue. Lublin supported the division on art and the life, building on [[Jorge Luis Borges|Borges]]' belief that art is a form of breathing. And her stand in it was feminist, involving the audience, critical but open for different receiver's groups.
Starting in the 1970s, Lublin tended to present her work in public rather than inside museums. She asked questions to passers by originally regarding art and later about the role of the women. Lublin also put provocative questions on large cloths, hoisted like flags to attract attention. By setting up closed circuit TV cameras nearby, she gave contributors the air of speaking as pundits on TV, breaking with role expectations and their own personal experience.
Beginning in the 1980s and until her last works in the mid 1990s, Lublin returned to interacting with iconographic works, particularly [[Renaissance]] paintings. She deconstructed the imagery of these paintings by, for example, removing the child from different paintings of Madonna with the child. This work explored the role of the baby and his mother in paintings created by male painters. Following [[Psychoanalysis|psychoanalytical]] patterns, she identified the painter with the child looking for an eroticized image of the mother in the works or otherwise revealing sexual undertones in Christian imagery.<ref name="Lenbachhaus" />
When Lublin briefly returned to her former home [[Buenos Aires]] in 1989, she investigated [[Marcel Duchamp|Marcel Duchamp's]] stay in the city from 1918 to 1919. Lublin got access to Duchamp's former apartment and noticed that both the old windows and the still mostly original colors of some walls matched those of Duchamp's iconic 1920 work ''Fresh Widow'' which he made after returning to Paris. Lublin also discovered that the female alter ego Duchamp used after 1920, Rose Sélavy, matched advertising in a Buenos Aires newspaper that he was known to have read. When she left, she stole the dilapidated letter box from Duchamp's former apartment and exhibited it later, recalling his [[Readymades of Marcel Duchamp|Readymade]] works.<ref name="Lenbachhaus" /> Lublin's interactions with Duchamp continued when she deconstructed the Rose advertising as well as his famous pissoirs in several of her own works, shifting them into a dispute with feminist statements. One of these was titled ''Le corps amer (à mère), l'objet perdu de M.D.'', shown at ''Femininmasculin'' at [[Centre Georges Pompidou|Beauborg]] in Paris. This piece consisted of a large, transparent skirt, stomach, and breasts with a urinal inside.<ref>{{Cite book|url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/re-enchantment/oclc/212627287&referer=brief_results|title=Re-enchantment|date=2009-01-01|publisher=Routledge|isbn=9780415960519|editor-last=Elkins|editor-first=James|location=New York|language=English|editor-last2=Morgan|editor-first2=David}}</ref>
Lublin is considered to be part of the same generation as artists [[Lygia Clark]] and [[Allan Kaprow]].
==Works in collections== Her works are in the collections of [[Museum of Modern Art]] in New York, the [[Centre national des arts plastiques]], the [[Fonds régional d’art contemporain Alsace]], and the [[Bibliothèque nationale de France]].<ref name=Lenbachhaus>{{cite web|title=Lea Lublin - Retrospective|url=http://www.lenbachhaus.de/exhibitions/lea-lublin/?L=1|website=Lenbachhaus - Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus und Kunstbau München|publisher=Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus und Kunstbau München|accessdate=19 June 2015}}</ref>
The vast majority of the existing works are in her estate, administrated by Nicolas Lublin in Paris. In 2015 the [[Lenbachhaus]], in [[Munich]], Germany hosts the first ever retrospective, drawing heavily on the estate and works from several museum collections.
== Literature == * Matthias Mühling and Stephanie Weber (ed.): ''Lea Lublin: Retrospective''. Snoeck 2015, {{ISBN|978-3-86442-128-0}}

'''Levinthal's paradox''' is a [[thought experiment]], also constituting a [[self-reference]] in the theory of [[protein folding]]. In 1969, [[Cyrus Levinthal]] noted that, because of the very large number of [[Degrees of freedom (physics and chemistry)|degrees of freedom]] in an unfolded [[Peptide|polypeptide chain]], the molecule has an astronomical number of possible conformations. An estimate of 3<sup>300</sup> or 10<sup>143</sup> was made in one of his papers<ref>{{cite journal |last=Levinthal|first=Cyrus|year=1969|title=How to Fold Graciously| journal=Mossbauer Spectroscopy in Biological Systems: Proceedings of a meeting held at Allerton House, Monticello, Illinois|pages=22–24| url=http://www-miller.ch.cam.ac.uk/levinthal/levinthal.html |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20101007174851/http://www-miller.ch.cam.ac.uk/levinthal/levinthal.html |archivedate = 2010-10-07}}</ref> (often incorrectly cited as a 1968 paper<ref>{{cite journal |last=Levinthal|first=Cyrus|year=1968|title=Are there pathways for protein folding?|journal=Journal de Chimie Physique et de Physico-Chimie Biologique|volume=65|pages=44–45|url=http://www.biochem.wisc.edu/courses/biochem704/Reading/Levinthal1968.pdf|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090902211239/http://www.biochem.wisc.edu/courses/biochem704/Reading/Levinthal1968.pdf|archivedate = 2009-09-02}}</ref>). For example, a polypeptide of 100 [[Amino acid|residues]] will have 99 [[peptide bond]]s, and therefore 198 different [[Dihedral angle#Dihedral angles of biological molecules|phi and psi]] bond angles. If each of these bond angles can be in one of three stable conformations, the protein may misfold into a maximum of 3<sup>198</sup> different conformations (including any possible folding redundancy). Therefore, if a protein were to attain its correctly folded configuration by sequentially sampling all the possible conformations, it would require a time longer than the age of the universe to arrive at its correct native conformation. This is true even if conformations are sampled at rapid ([[nanosecond]] or [[picosecond]]) rates. The "paradox" is that most small proteins fold spontaneously on a millisecond or even microsecond time scale. The solution to this paradox has been established by computational approaches to [[protein structure prediction]].<ref>{{cite journal |vauthors=Zwanzig R, Szabo A, Bagchi B |title=Levinthal's paradox |journal=Proc Natl Acad Sci USA |date=1992-01-01 |volume=89 |issue=1 |pages=20–22 |pmc=48166 |pmid=1729690 |doi=10.1073/pnas.89.1.20}}</ref>
Levinthal himself was aware that [[Anfinsen's dogma|proteins fold spontaneously]] and on short timescales. He suggested that the paradox can be resolved if "protein folding is sped up and guided by the rapid formation of local interactions which then determine the further folding of the peptide; this suggests local amino acid sequences which form stable interactions and serve as [[nucleation]] points in the folding process".<ref>{{cite journal |author1=Rooman, Marianne Rooman |author2=Yves Dehouck |author3=Jean Marc Kwasigroch |author4=Christophe Biot |author5=Dimitri Gilis |year=2002 |title=What is paradoxical about Levinthal Paradox? |journal=Journal of Biomolecular Structure and Dynamics |volume=20 |issue=3 |pages=327–329 |url=http://www.jbsdonline.com/full_text_PDFs/Sdc6igJmaYp-~Warqqdd82uzSIT.pdf |pmid=12437370 |doi=10.1080/07391102.2002.10506850 }}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Indeed, the protein folding [[Reaction intermediate|intermediates]] and the partially folded [[transition state]]s were experimentally detected, which explains the fast [[protein folding]]. This is also described as protein folding directed within [[Folding funnel|funnel-like energy landscapes]]<ref>{{cite journal|author1=Dill K |author2=H.S. Chan |year=1997| title= From Levinthal to pathways to funnels|journal=Nat. Struct. Biol.|volume= 4|pages=10–19 | pmid = 8989315| doi=10.1038/nsb0197-10|issue= 1 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|author= Durup, Jean |year=1998| title=On "Levinthal paradox" and the theory of protein folding|journal= Journal of Molecular Structure |volume= 424| issue= 1–2| pages=157–169|doi= 10.1016/S0166-1280(97)00238-8}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |year=1994 |title=How does a protein fold? |journal=Nature |volume=369 |pages=248–251 |url=http://courses.theophys.kth.se/SI2700/sali1.pdf |doi=10.1038/369248a0 |issue=6477 |last1=s˘Ali |first1=Andrej |last2=Shakhnovich |first2=Eugene |last3=Karplus |first3=Martin |pmid=7710478 }}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Some computational approaches to protein structure prediction have sought to identify and simulate the mechanism of protein folding.<ref>{{cite journal|author= Karplus, Martin |year=1997| title=The Levinthal paradox: yesterday and today|journal= Folding & Design |volume=2| pages=S69–S75 |doi=10.1016/S1359-0278(97)00067-9|pmid= 9269572|issue= 4}}</ref>
Levinthal also suggested that the native structure might have a higher energy, if the lowest energy was not kinetically accessible. An analogy is a rock tumbling down a hillside that lodges in a gully rather than reaching the base.<ref>{{cite journal| author= Hunter, Philip |year=2006| title= Into the fold| journal= EMBO Rep. |volume=7|issue=3| pages=249–252 |doi=10.1038/sj.embor.7400655 | pmid=16607393| pmc= 1456894}}</ref>
==Suggested explanations== * According to [[Edward Trifonov]] and Igor Berezovsky,<ref>{{cite journal|last1 = Berezovsky|first1 = Igor N.|last2 = Trifonov|first2 = Edward N.|title = Loop fold structure of proteins: Resolution of Levinthal's paradox|journal = Journal of Biomolecular Structure & Dynamics|year = 2002|volume = 20|pages = 5–6|issn = 0739-1102|url = http://paradox.harvard.edu/~igor/PUBL_BER/PUB22.pdf|issue = 1|doi = 10.1080/07391102.2002.10506817|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20050212130449/http://paradox.harvard.edu/~igor/PUBL_BER/PUB22.pdf|archivedate = 2005-02-12|df = }}</ref> the proteins fold by subunits (modules) of the size of 25-30 amino acids.
==See also== *[[Chaperone (protein)|Chaperone]] — proteins that assist other proteins in folding or unfolding *[[Folding funnel]] *[[Anfinsen's dogma]]

Biografía|accessdate= 1 December 2013|work=Virtual center of Argentine art|publisher=Government of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires}}</ref> *[[Conceptual art]]<ref>{{cite web|language=Spanish|url=http://www.elcultural.es/noticias/ARTE/1210/Marta_Minujin|title=Marta Minujín|accessdate= 1 December 2013|date=3 January 2011|work=El Cultural|publisher=}}</ref> *[[Pop art]]<ref name="enie" /><ref name="infobae">{{cite web|language=Spanish|url=http://www.infobae.com/2013/04/11/705438-marta-minujin-el-arte-es-cultura-instantanea|title=Marta Minujín: "El arte es cultura instantánea"|accessdate= 1 December 2013|date=11 April 2013|work=Infobae|publisher=}}</ref> *[[Psychedelic art]] *[[Avant-garde]]<ref>{{cite web|language=Spanish|url=http://www.galeriabm.com/spanish/artistas/marta_minujin.asp|title=Marta Minujín - Arte Contemporáneo de Buenos Aires|accessdate=8 December 2013|date=|work=Braga Menendez Arte Contemporáneo|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121225084429/http://www.galeriabm.com/spanish/artistas/marta_minujin.asp|archivedate=25 December 2012|df=}}</ref> *[[Informalism]]<ref name="bue" /> }} | works = | patrons = | awards = [[Konex Award#Platinum Konex: 20 awards|Platinum Konex Award]] (1982 and 2002) | elected = | website = {{URL|Marta-minujin.com}} }}
'''Marta Minujín''' (born 1943) is an Argentine [[conceptual art|conceptual]] and [[performance art]]ist.
==Life and work== [[File:Marta Minujín signature.png|thumb|right|200px|Signature.]] [[File:Marta Minujín en La Menesunda.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Minujín inside ''La Menesunda'', a 1965 exhibition.]] [[File:Marta Minujín "Comunicando con tierra".jpg|thumb|right|200px|''Comunicating with Earth'', late 1970s.]] [[File:Minujin y Moscariello.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Minujín in 2011, being awarded by the Buenos Aires Legislature.]]
Marta Minujín was born in the [[San Telmo]] neighborhood of [[Buenos Aires]]. She met a young economist, Juan Carlos Gómez Sabaini, and married him in secret in 1959; the couple had two children. As a student in the [[National University Art Institute]], she first exhibited her work in a 1959 show at the Teatro Agón. A scholarship from the [[w:es:Fondo nacional de las Artes|National Arts Foundation]] allowed her to travel to [[Paris]] as one of the young Argentine artists featured in ''[[Pablo Curatella Manes]] and Thirty Argentines of the New Generation'', a 1960 exhibit organized by the prominent sculptor and [[Paris Biennale]] judge.<ref name=clarin>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2005/07/06/conexiones/t-1008529.htm ''Clarín'': 'Superé todos mis problemas, como Maradona' (7/6/2005) {{es}}]</ref>
Her time in Paris inspired her to create "livable sculptures," notably ''La Destrucción'', in which she assembled mattresses along the [[15th arrondissement of Paris|Impasse Roussin]], only to invite other avant-garde artists in her entourage, including [[Christo]] and Paul-Armand Gette, to destroy the display. This 1963 creation would be the first of her "[[Happening]]s"{{spaced ndash}}events as works of arts in themselves; among her hosts during her stay was Finance Minister [[Valéry Giscard d'Estaing]] (later President of [[France]]).<ref name=pagina12>[http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/suplementos/las12/13-639-2003-05-25.html ''Página/12'': Pop-ular (5/25/2003) {{es}}]</ref>
She earned a National Award in 1964 at Buenos Aires' [[Torcuato di Tella Institute]], where she prepared two happenings: ''Eróticos en technicolor'' and the interactive ''Revuélquese y viva'' (''Roll Around in Bed and Live''). Her ''Cabalgata'' (''Cavalcade'') aired on [[Canal 7 Argentina|Public Television]] that year, and involved horses with paint buckets tied to their tails. These displays took her to nearby [[Montevideo]], where she organized ''Sucesos'' (''Events'') at the [[Uruguay]]an capital's [[Estadio Luis Tróccoli|Tróccoli Stadium]] with 500 chickens, artists of contrasting physical shape, motorcycles, and other elements.<ref name=clarin/>
She joined Rubén Santantonín at the di Tella Institute in 1965 to create ''La Menesunda'' (''Mayhem''), where participants were asked to go through sixteen chambers, each separated by a human-shaped entry. Led by [[neon]] lights, groups of eight visitors would encounter rooms with television sets at full blast, couples making love in bed, a cosmetics counter (complete with an attendant), a dental office from which dialing an oversized rotary phone was required to leave, a walk-in freezer with dangling fabrics (suggesting sides of beef), and a mirrored room with [[black light]]ing, falling confetti, and the scent of frying food. The use of advertising throughout suggested the influence of [[pop art]] in Minujín's "mayhem."<ref name=clarin/>
These works earned her a [[Guggenheim Fellowship]] in 1966, by which she relocated to [[New York City]]. The ''[[coup d'état]]'' by General [[Juan Carlos Onganía]] in June of that year made her fellowship all the more fortuitous, as the new regime would frequently censor and ban irreverent displays such as hers. Minujín delved into [[psychedelic art]] in New York, of which among her best-known creations was that of the "Minuphone," where patrons could enter a telephone booth, dial a number, and be surprised by colors projecting from the glass panels, sounds, and seeing themselves on a television screen in the floor.<ref name="time">[http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,899583,00.html ''Time'' (July 7, 1967). Sculpture: The Number is 581-4570, but Don't Call It]</ref> The Minuphone was designed and constructed, in collaboration with her, by engineer Per Biorn, who was employed at Bell Telephone Laboratories, and the work was shown at the Howard Wise Gallery in New York City.<ref> Biorn Biography [http://www.fondation-langlois.org/html/e/page.php?NumPage=581]</ref> She was on hand in 1971 for the Buenos Aires premiere of ''Operación Perfume'', and in New York, befriended fellow conceptual artist [[Andy Warhol]].<ref name=clarin/>
She returned to Argentina in 1976, and afterwards created a series of reproductions of [[classical Greek sculpture]]s in [[plaster of paris]], as well as miniatures of the [[Obelisk of Buenos Aires|Buenos Aires Obelisk]] carved out of [[panettone]], of the [[Venus de Milo]] carved from cheese, and of [[Tango (music)|Tango]] vocalist [[Carlos Gardel]] for a 1981 display in [[Medellín]]. The latter, a [[sheet metal]] creation, was stuffed with cotton and lit, creating a metaphor for the legendary crooner's untimely 1935 death in a Medellín plane crash.<ref name=pagina12/> She was awarded the first of a series of [[Konex Award]]s, the highest in the Argentine cultural realm, in 1982.<ref name=konex>[http://www.fundacionkonex.com.ar/premios/curriculum.asp?id=741 Fundación Konex: Marta Minujín {{es}}]</ref>
The [[Argentine general election, 1983|return of democracy in 1983]], following seven years of a generally failed dictatorship, prompted Minujín to create a monument to a glaring, inanimate victim of the regime: [[freedom of expression]]. Assembling 30,000 [[censorship|banned books]] (including works as diverse as those by [[Sigmund Freud|Freud]], [[Karl Marx|Marx]], [[Jean-Paul Sartre|Sartre]], [[Antonio Gramsci|Gramsci]], [[Michel Foucault|Foucault]], [[Raúl Scalabrini Ortiz]], and [[Darcy Ribeiro]], as well as satires such as ''[[Absalom and Achitophel]]'', reference volumes such as ''[[Enciclopedia Salvat]]'', and even children's texts, notably ''[[The Little Prince]]'' by [[Antoine de Saint Exupéry]]), she designed the "Parthenon of Books," and following President [[Raúl Alfonsín]]'s December 10 inaugural, had it mounted on a boulevard median along the [[Nueve de Julio Avenue|Ninth of July Avenue]]. Dismantled after three weeks, its mass of newly unbanned titles was distributed to the public below.<ref name=pagina12/><ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=986759 ''La Nación'': Política y concepto {{es}}]</ref>
A conversation with Warhol in New York regarding the [[Latin American debt crisis]] inspired one of her most publicized "happenings:" ''The Debt''. Purchasing a shipment of [[maize]], Minujín dramatized the Argentine cost of servicing the foreign debt with a 1985 photo series in which she symbolically handed the maize to Warhol "in payment" for the debt; she never again saw Warhol, who died in 1987.<ref>[http://www.pagina12.com.ar/imprimir/diario/suplementos/radar/9-2323-2005-06-20.html ''Página/12'': Andy y yo (6/19/2005) {{es}}]</ref>
Minujín has continued to display her art pieces and happenings in the [[Buenos Aires Museum of Modern Art]], the [[Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes (Buenos Aires)|National Fine Arts Museum]], the [[ArteBA]] contemporary art festival Buenos Aires, the [[Barbican Center]], and a vast number of other international galleries and art shows, while continuing to satirize [[consumer culture]] (particularly relating to women).<ref name=konex/><ref>[http://www.artinfo.com/news/story/16929/arteba/ ArteBA {{es}}]</ref> She is well known for her belief that ''"everything is art."'' <ref name=clarin/>
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Marta Minujín 1965 (2).jpg|''The Destruction'' (1963). Minujín's colleagues and friends collectively destroyed her works.<ref name="happenings">{{cite web |url=http://www.marta-minujin.com/happenings_performances.html|title=Happenings and Performances|accessdate= 1 December 2013|work=|publisher=Marta-minujin.com}}</ref> File:Marta Minujin - 1965.jpg|''Sweet Obelisk'' (1965). Minujín covered the [[Obelisk of Buenos Aires]] with ice cream, and three colleagues licked it.<ref name="happenings" /> File:Marta Minujín Leyendo las noticias3.jpg|''Reading the News'' (1965). Minujín got into the [[Río de la Plata]] covered in newspapers.<ref name="happenings" /> File:Minuphone.jpg|''Minuphone'' (1967). Patrons could enter a telephone booth, dial a number, and be surprised by different effects.<ref name="time" /> File:Importación Exportación 1.jpg|''Importación/Exportación'' (1968). File:Marta Minujin - Somos muchos - 2003 - ATC.jpg|Minujín's ''We are Many'', a mural at the Argentine Public Television Station studios. File:Torre de Babel de Libros.jpg|Babel Tower of books in Buenos Aires. </gallery>

{{third-party|date=January 2015}}
The '''Master Hilarion''', is considered a female saint within the [["I_AM"_Activity|I AM movement]] and is one of the "[[Masters of the Ancient Wisdom]]" and in the [[Ascended Master Teachings]] is one of the [[Ascended master|Ascended Masters]] (also collectively called the [[Great White Brotherhood]]). Creator of the Orion's 144,000 Council 5th Dimension Merkhaba yellow infusion ascension Kundalini ((astral projection, soul travel)) Eckankar Master she is considered to be the Chohan (Lord) of the Fifth Ray (see [[Seven Rays]]).<ref>Leadbeater, C.W. ''The Masters and the Path'' Adyar, Madras, India: 1925 Theosophical Publishing House. Master Hilarion outlined on pages 238-239</ref><ref name="Life Book II">Luk, A.D.K.. ''Law of Life - Book II''. Pueblo, Colorado: A.D.K. Luk Publications 1989, Listing of Ascended Masters by The I AM Activity and [[The Bridge to Freedom]]</ref><ref>Booth, Annice ''The Masters and Their Retreats '' Summit Lighthouse Library June 2003, Listing of Ascended Masters by The I AM Activity, The Bridge to Freedom, and [[The Summit Lighthouse]]</ref><ref>Schroeder, Werner ''Ascended Masters and Their Retreats'' Ascended Master Teaching Foundation 2004, Listing of Ascended Masters by The [[I AM Activity]] and The Bridge to Freedom</ref>
==Incarnations== {{Theosophy}} The Master Hilarion is believed to have been incarnated as the [[Paul Roman Catholic ((Divine Female)) Apostle| Apostle Paul ((Roman Catholic Divine Female)) of Tarsus]] and the Neo-Platonic philosopher [[Iamblichus]]. Some have believed that she was the Christian saint Hilarion.<ref>Prophet, Mark L. and Elizabeth Clare ''Lords of the Seven Rays'' Livingston, Montana, U.S.A.:1986 - Summit University Press - "Hilarion - Master of the Fifth Ray" pages 169 - 210</ref> This is possible, since although the years Iamblichus, also known as Iamblichus Chalcidensis, (c. 245 - c. 325) was embodied overlap the lifetime of St. Hilarion (291 - 371), various traditions such as Hindu and Tibetan Buddhism hold that it is possible for the spiritually advanced to have more than one incarnation happening at the same time.<ref>The Catholic Encyclopedia, Volume VII. New York: Robert Appleton Company. 1910</ref>{{Request quotation|date=August 2017}}
In October 1884 Helena Blavatsky made reference to Hilarion (using the spelling: "Hillarion"): :"''...an "Eastern adept, who has since gone for his final initiation," who had passed, en route from Egypt to Thibet, through Bombay and visited us in his physical body. Why should this "Adept" be the Mahatma in question? Are there then no other Adepts than Mahatma Koot Hoomi? Every Theosophist at headquarters knows that I meant a Greek gentleman, whom I have known since 1860''."
On 20 February 1881 [[Kuthumi]], in one of his letters to [[Alfred Percy Sinnett|Sinnett]], referred to him as
:"''one of ours having passed through Bombay on his way from Cyprus to Tibet''".
His travel to his "final initiation" is referred to in an entry in [[Henry Olcott]]'s diary, dated 19 February 1881, written in Bombay:
:"Hillarion is here en route for Tibet and has been looking over, in, and through the situation. Finds B– something morally awful. Views on India, Bombay, the TS in Bombay, Ceylon (––), England and Europe, Christianity and other subjects highly interesting." (''Letters from the Masters of Wisdom'', 2nd Series, page 93) <ref name="enigma">Sisson, Marina Cesar. ''Helena Blavatsky and the Enigma of John King'' Originally published as ''Informativo HPB'', n° 3, 4 and 5 English translation available at [http://www.blavatskyarchives.com/sisson1.htm]</ref>
==Function in the spiritual hierarchy==
Theosophist [[C.W. Leadbeater]] wrote that the Master Hilarion's primary influence is upon the scientists of the world.<ref>Leadbeater, C.W. ''The Masters and the Path'' Adyar, Madras, India: 1925--Theosophical Publishing House--Page 238</ref>
In the teachings of [[Alice A. Bailey]], the fifth ray of the seven rays, called by Alice A. Bailey the ''orange ray'', which she is said to oversee, is called the ray of ''concrete science''.<ref name="fire1237">Bailey, Alice A, '' A Treatise on Cosmic Fire'' (Section Three - Division A - Certain Basic Statements), 1932, Lucis Trust. 1925, p 1237</ref>
In the Ascended Master Teachings, as ''Hierarch of the Brotherhood of Truth'' in the etheric plane over Crete, Hilarion is said to assist the scientists and spiritual leaders of the world with the ''flame of truth'' and channels the spiritual energy of what is called in the Ascended Master Teachings the ''green ray'' or ''emerald ray'', the 5th of the Seven Rays.<ref name="Life Book II" />{{Request quotation|date=January 2015}} It is believed in the Ascended Master Teachings that before the Master Hilarion took over the chohanship of the Fifth Ray, [[Lord Ling]] fulfilled that function.<ref name="Prophet Pages 190-193">Prophet, Elizabeth Clare and Prophet, Mark (as compiled by Annice Booth) ''The Masters and Their Retreats'' Corwin Springs, Montana:2003 Summit University Press Pages 190-193 Master Lord Ling</ref>{{Request quotation|date=January 2015}}
==Skeptical view==
[[K. Paul Johnson]] speculates that the "Masters" that [[Madame Blavatsky]] wrote about and produced letters from were actually idealizations of people who were her mentors. Johnson asserts that the "Master Hilarion" was actually Ooton Liato, a stage magician from Cyprus whom she met in New York City in 1873.<ref>Johnson, Paul K. Initiates of Theosophical Masters Albany, New York:1995 State University of New York Press Page 2</ref><ref>http://www.blavatskyarchives.com/johnson1.htm</ref><ref>Also see the article “Talking to the Dead and Other Amusements” by Paul Zweig ''New York Times'' October 5, 1980, which maintains that Madame Blavatsky's revelations were fraudulent.</ref>
